16.1. Introduction


Up: Tool Support Next: Profiling Interface Previous: Tool Support

This chapter discusses interfaces that allow debuggers, performance analyzers, and other tools to extract information about the behavior of MPI processes. Specifically, this chapter defines both the MPI profiling interface (Section Profiling Interface), which supports the transparent interception and inspection of MPI calls, and the MPI tool information interface (Section The MPI Tool Information Interface), which supports the inspection and manipulation of MPI control and performance variables, as well as the registration of callbacks for MPI library events. The interfaces described in this chapter are all defined in the context of an MPI process, i.e., are callable from the same code that invokes other MPI functions.
